data.text:
Iran’s W Azarbaijan exports 1 mn tons of goods: official

TEHRAN, Aug. 06 (MNA) – The governor of West Azarbaijan province said that one million tons of goods, valued at $600 million, were exported from the customs offices of the province in the current Iranian calendar year (started March 21, 2024).

Jameh Mosque of Urmia

TEHRAN, Apr. 23 (MNA) – Jameh Mosque of Urmia is a grand, congregational mosque of Urmia City, West Azarbaijan Province, Iran. It was built during the 13th century in the Ilkhanate era and is located in the older part of the city.

Lake Urmia in northwest Iran

TEHRAN, Oct. 22 (MNA) – Located in West Azarbaijan province, Lake Urmia is considered the largest saltwater lake in Iran. Continuous declines in water flowing into the lake have caused a general decline in its surface area since 1995.
